pageContext.description: A copper-alloy spiral ring suspected to be of middle Bronze Age date, dating to c. 1500 to 1150 BC and attributable to the 'ornament horizon' of the Taunton and Penard metalwork phases. The spiral is circular in plan and formed of three coils of an oval cross-sectioned metal wire with rounded ends. The spiral has an internal diameter of 20.5mm. The exterior surface is heavily pitted; the interior has a smooth dark green patina.
pageContext.notes: See also SF-4497E7, HAMP-7556B3 and SF-761FF6. There are also examples of comparable spiraloid rings in the Near Lewes hoard (SUSS-C5D042) and the Ockham hoard (SUR-B41DB6), both Middle Bronze Age in date.
